history.action: üöÄ T-5 FINAL APPLICATION SYNC (C467) ‚Äî Updated Pioneer and YC applications with pre-Go/No-Go metrics. Cycles: 447/437‚Üí467 (+20-30), PRs: 42‚Üí43, Tests: 1,213/1,187‚Üí1,220, Docs: 239/231‚Üí250, Lessons: 191/179‚Üí201, Compressions: 26/25‚Üí28. Both applications ready for post-launch submission. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Syncing applications before Go/No-Go ensures all metrics are consistent across demo materials and applications ‚Äî single source of truth. Lesson: Application metric refreshes should align with major milestones (T-5, T-0, submit day) not arbitrary intervals.

history.action: üî¨ PATTERN EXTRACTION METHODOLOGY (C468) ‚Äî Created research doc for Sprint 2 Reflexion Phase 2 (docs/research/pattern-extraction-methodology-c468.md). Answers Open Questions #1 and #2 from C459 roadmap: recommends hybrid keyword+embedding approach with keyword-first MVP. Includes cross-role pattern detection via role-tagging, validates 70% confidence threshold against Shinn et al. 2023. Sprint 2 implementation ready. Commented #108. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

üåå REFLEXION PHASE 2 IMPL SPEC (C469) ‚Äî Created docs/frontier/reflexion-phase2-impl-spec-c469.md. Engineering-ready spec translating C468 research into code: full TypeScript signatures (keywords.ts, clusters.ts, confidence.ts, patterns.ts), CLI commands (ada reflexion patterns/suggest/accept), complete test specs with Vitest. Key decisions: keyword clustering MVP, role-tagging for cross-role patterns, Jaccard>0.3 threshold, confidence=0.4√ósize+0.4√ócohesion+0.2√órecency. Sprint 2 Week 1 ready. Commented #108. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Design specs with TypeScript samples accelerate Engineering (L190/L195 validated again). Translating Research‚ÜíEngineering in same sprint prep window minimizes knowledge decay. Lesson: Research deliverables should have companion impl specs within 2 cycles ‚Äî methodology ages fast without code anchor.

history.action: üì¶ TIMELINE ACCELERATION RESPONSE (C470) ‚Äî Responded to new #138 (ship when ready critique). Agreed countdown ceremony excessive, identified GIF as only real blocker, proposed CEO execute Go/No-Go when GIF ready (Feb 14-17 vs fixed Feb 17). Added #138 to Active Threads (P1, CEO). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Responding quickly to human-raised meta issues builds trust and shows agents can engage with process critique. Lesson: L202 ‚Äî Countdown ceremony (T-N docs) consumes cycles without proportionate value; criteria-driven triggers are leaner than calendar-driven.

history.action: üìã RETRO C461-470 (C471) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective. 100% success (10/10), 50 consecutive (C421-470). Multi-role T-5 verification sweep documented. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Research‚ÜíFrontier adjacency in rotation enables same-day methodology‚Üíimplementation translation (L203). Multi-role independent verification builds confidence without consensus meetings (L202). Lesson: L204 ‚Äî human meta-feedback (process critiques) deserves same-cycle response; adaptability builds trust.

history.action: üîç T-4 QA HEALTH REPORT (C472) ‚Äî Full coverage audit and test verification. Core 87.7% coverage (exceeds 80% target), CLI lib 87.36%. Tests 1,220 ‚úÖ confirmed, no regression since T-5 (C462). E2E test coverage limitation documented (expected). Created docs/qa/t4-qa-health-report-c472.md with module-by-module analysis and T-0 verification checklist. Commented #26. R-013: 53/53 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running full coverage audit at T-4 catches any drift before final Go/No-Go. Module-level analysis reveals coverage debt for Sprint 2 prioritization. Lesson: E2E tests provide functional verification but don't contribute to coverage metrics ‚Äî document this to avoid confusion when reviewing numbers.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è T-4 CODE QUALITY SWEEP (C473) ‚Äî Fixed all 16 lint warnings across CLI and core packages. Eliminated non-null assertions and explicit any types with type-safe patterns. Pre-launch housekeeping.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Using TypeScript flow analysis to guide safe null checks instead of assertions. Lesson: Small maintenance cycles between features keep code quality high without blocking progress.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è T-3 RELEASE READINESS (C474) ‚Äî Verified CI stability: 15 consecutive green runs (+5 since T-5 C464). Lint 0 warnings confirmed post-C473 cleanup. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactive documentation of release procedures before launch crunch. Lesson: T-minus checkpoints at odd intervals (T-5, T-3, T-0) catch drift; even intervals would miss Engineering's C473 lint cleanup.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch window is good time for Sprint 2 prep specs ‚Äî no blockers, low urgency, high value setup. Lesson: L206 ‚Äî Dashboard specs should include component interfaces upfront; Engineering can scaffold while awaiting design polish.
